definition: cat burglar/burglar who gains entrance by scaling walls/intruding enemy airman/air marauder

sentences.english: Stick two small white or silver feathers into the Styrofoam ball to serve as the wings of the snitch.
sentences.chinese: 你的金色飞贼别忘了加上两个银色的翅膀。

sentences.english: Coolidge, knowing there was $ 80 in the billfold, persuaded the intruder to sit down and talk.
sentences.chinese: 柯立芝知道钱包里有80美元，他劝飞贼坐下来谈谈。
我认为你是我的金色飞贼。

sentences.english: Player whose objective is to spot and catch the Golden Snitch .
sentences.chinese: 以发现并捉住金色飞贼为目标的球员。

sentences.english: He nearly dropped the Snitch in surprise and excitement.
sentences.chinese: 他激动和惊讶得差点把金色飞贼扔掉。

sentences.english: His eyes lingered for a moment on the giant Snitch cake.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光在那巨大的金色飞贼蛋糕上逗留了片刻。

sentences.english: The Seeker who catches the Snitch ends the game.
sentences.chinese: 捕球手一抢到金色飞贼，比赛就宣布结束。

definition: lit. the gentleman on the roof beam/fig. a thief
bailiff responsible for catching criminals (in imperial China)
petty thief (lit. quick fingered and vanish)/empty-handed/having nothing
to break into a house when nobody is home
insect that damages cereal crop seedlings/(lit. and fig.) vermin/a person harmful to the country and the people
